verses.text: Afterward he brought me to the gate, \add even\add* the gate that looketh toward the east:
and behold, the glory of the God of Israel came from the way of the east: and his voice \add was\add* like a noise of many waters: and the earth shined with his glory.

And \add it was\add* according to the appearance of the vision which I saw, \add even\add* according to the vision that I saw when I came to destroy the city: and the visions \add were\add* like the vision that I saw by the river Chebar; and I fell upon my face.
And the glory of the \sc Lord\sc* came into the house by the way of the gate whose prospect \add is\add* toward the east.
So the spirit took me up, and brought me into the inner court; and behold, the glory of the \sc Lord\sc* filled the house.
And I heard \add him\add* speaking unto me out of the house; and \add the\add* man stood by me.

And he said unto me, Son of man, the place of my throne, and the place of the soles of my feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the children of Israel for ever, and my holy name, shall the house of Israel no more defile, \add neither\add* they, nor their kings, by their whoredom, nor by the carcases of their kings \add in\add* their high places.

In their setting of their threshold by my thresholds, and their post by my posts, and the wall between me and them, they have even defiled my holy name by their abominations that they have committed: wherefore I have consumed them in mine anger.
Now let them put away their whoredom, and the carcases of their kings, far from me, and I will dwell in the midst of them for ever.
Thou son of man, shew the house to the house of Israel, that they may be ashamed of their iniquities: and let them measure the pattern.

And if they be ashamed of all that they have done, shew them the form of the house, and the fashion thereof, and the goings out thereof, and the comings in thereof, and all the forms thereof, and all the ordinances thereof, and all the forms thereof, and all the laws thereof: and write \add it\add* in their sight, that they may keep the whole form thereof, and all the ordinances thereof, and do them.
This \add is\add* the law of the house; Upon the top of the mountain the whole limit thereof round about \add shall be\add* most holy. Behold, this \add is\add* the law of the house.

And these \add are\add* the measures of the altar after the cubits: The cubit \add is\add* a cubit and a hand breadth; even the bottom \add shall be\add* a cubit, and the breadth a cubit, and the border thereof by the edge thereof round about \add shall be\add* a span: and this \add shall be\add* the higher place of the altar.

And from the bottom \add upon\add* the ground \add even\add* to the lower settle \add shall be\add* two cubits, and the breadth one cubit; and from the lesser settle \add even\add* to the greater settle \add shall be\add* four cubits, and the breadth \add one\add* cubit.
So the altar \add shall be\add* four cubits; and from the altar and upward \add shall be\add* four horns.
And the altar \add shall be\add* twelve \add cubits\add* long, twelve broad, square in the four squares thereof.

And the settle \add shall be\add* fourteen \add cubits\add* long and fourteen broad in the four squares thereof; and the border about it \add shall be\add* half a cubit; and the bottom thereof \add shall be\add* a cubit about; and his stairs \add shall\add* look toward the east.

And he said unto me, Son of man, thus saith the Lord \sc God\sc*; These \add are\add* the ordinances of the altar in the day when \add they\add* shall make it, to offer burnt offerings thereon, and to sprinkle blood thereon.
And thou shalt give to the priests the Levites that \add be\add* of the seed of Zadok, which approach unto me, to minister unto me, saith the Lord \sc God\sc*, a young bullock for a sin offering.
And thou shalt take of the blood thereof, and put \add it\add* on the four horns of it, and on the four corners of the settle, and upon the border round about: thus shalt thou cleanse and purge it.
Thou shalt take the bullock also of the sin offering, and he shall burn it in the appointed place of the house, without the sanctuary.
And on the second day thou shalt offer a kid of the goats without blemish for a sin offering; and they shall cleanse the altar, as they did cleanse \add it\add* with the bullock.
When thou hast made an end of cleansing \add it\add*, thou shalt offer a young bullock without blemish, and a ram out of the flock without blemish.
And thou shalt offer them before the \sc Lord\sc*, and the priests shall cast salt upon them, and they shall offer them up \add for\add* a burnt offering unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
Seven days shalt thou prepare every day a goat \add for\add* a sin offering: they shall also prepare a young bullock, and a ram out of the flock, without blemish.
Seven days shall they purge the altar and purify it; and they shall consecrate themselves.

And when \add these\add* days are expired, it shall be, \add that\add* upon the eight day, and \add so\add* forward, the priests shall make your burnt offerings upon the altar, and your peace offerings; and I will accept you, saith the Lord \sc God\sc*.
